displaymaker: Gigadō Ashiyuki 戯画堂芦幸, active 1813–1834, Osaka, Japan | Published by Iden 井傳 (Izutsuya Denbei 井筒屋傳兵衞), active 1820–1835, Osaka, Japan
caption: Japanese, Edo period (1603–1868), Gigadō Ashiyuki 戯画堂芦幸 (active 1813–1834, Osaka, Japan), Published by Iden 井傳 (Izutsuya Denbei 井筒屋傳兵衞) (active 1820–1835, Osaka, Japan), Arashi Rikan II as Miyamoto Musashi (Nidaime Arashi Rikan Miyamoto Musashi二代目嵐璃寛宮本武蔵) in the play A Tale of Revenge and Great Courage on Two Islands (Katakiuchi nitō eiyūki 復讐二島英雄記), 1832. Woodblock print (ōban tate-e format): ink, color, embossing, gold, and silver on paper; 38.7 × 26.4 cm. Museum purchase, Laura P. Hall Memorial Fund, selected for acquisition by students in ART 425: The Japanese Print (2024-109)
